Reference Drawing(s)/Location: File: A0768 - LIFE SAFETY PLAN - LEVEL 68 - ROOF.pdf
Observation/Comments: Mechanical and equipment areas on the roof are shown without indication of sprinkler protection or FP riser routing; potential omission of required protection and coordination with equipment clearances.

Reference Drawing(s)/Location: File: A0768 - LIFE SAFETY PLAN - LEVEL 68 - ROOF.pdf
Observation/Comments: Fire-rated stair and shaft enclosures at roof level are indicated architecturally but there is no detail on FP piping penetrations or firestopping at roof/shaft interfaces.

Reference Drawing(s)/Location: File: S4010_TYPICAL OPENINGS AND EMBEDMENTS IN CONCRETE.pdf
Observation/Comments: Typical opening/embeddment details establish structural limitations but do not reference coordination with fire sprinkler mains, standpipes, or fire pump suction/discharge piping; risk that FP sleeve sizes and locations will conflict with PT tendons and reinforcement.

Reference Drawing(s)/Location: File: S4010_TYPICAL OPENINGS AND EMBEDMENTS IN CONCRETE.pdf
Observation/Comments: PT slab penetration criteria are shown without any reserved zones or minimum clear areas for fire protection risers and large mains; FP routing through PT slabs may not be constructible without tendon revisions.

Reference Drawing(s)/Location: File: S4010_TYPICAL OPENINGS AND EMBEDMENTS IN CONCRETE.pdf
Observation/Comments: Conduit placement criteria address electrical/mechanical conduits but do not mention sprinkler piping or hanger inserts; need clarification that FP piping and seismic bracing inserts are coordinated with tendon and rebar layouts.

Reference Drawing(s)/Location: File: M-307_MECHANICAL FUEL OIL DIAGRAM - FIRE PUMP.pdf
Observation/Comments: Diagram shows diesel fire pump fuel system but does not indicate fire pump room fire-resistance rating, separation from other occupancies, or door rating; compliance with NFPA 20 room separation requirements is unclear.

Reference Drawing(s)/Location: File: M-307_MECHANICAL FUEL OIL DIAGRAM - FIRE PUMP.pdf
Observation/Comments: Access and working clearances around the fire pump, fuel tank, and associated piping are not dimensioned; ability to install and maintain FP equipment per NFPA 20 is uncertain.

Reference Drawing(s)/Location: File: M-307_MECHANICAL FUEL OIL DIAGRAM - FIRE PUMP.pdf
Observation/Comments: Fuel oil diagram does not reference required fire pump test header, relief valve discharge routing, or connection to sprinkler/standpipe riser; overall FP system interface to the pump is not documented.

Reference Drawing(s)/Location: File: M-307_MECHANICAL FUEL OIL DIAGRAM - FIRE PUMP.pdf
Observation/Comments: Penetrations of fuel oil piping through walls and floors are shown without indication of fire-rated assemblies or firestopping details where passing through rated construction; coordination with FP and architectural fire-resistance requirements is missing.
